title: 105_hr2546
content: The "Higher Education Fairness Act of 1997" is the short title of this Act. Any references to amendments or repeals in this Act are considered to be related to the Higher Education Act of 1965. Section 2 discusses the family contribution for dependent students. The amendment to Section 475 of the Higher Education Fairness Act of 1997 includes changes to parents' available income and student contribution from available income. This involves adjustments to tax credits and student contribution amounts. The amendment includes changes to tax credits for students under section 25A of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. SEC. 3. FAMILY CONTRIBUTION FOR INDEPENDENT STUDENTS WITHOUT DEPENDENTS OTHER THAN A SPOUSE. Amendments are made to the Family's Contribution From Available Income and Income Protection Allowances under section 476(b)(1)(A) of the Higher Education Act. This includes changes to tax credit amounts and income allowances for students without dependents other than a spouse. Amendments are made to the Family Contribution for Independent Students with Dependents other than a spouse, including the addition of tax credits taken under section 25A of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Additionally, regulations and updated tables and amounts are addressed. Amendments to Section 478(b) (20 U.S.C. 1087rr(b)) include revised tables and amounts for income protection allowances, based on Consumer Price Index increases. Amendments to Section 480 regarding total income, excludable income, and other financial assistance, specifically related to tax credits under section 25A of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Tax credits under section 25A of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 are not considered estimated financial assistance for purposes of section 471(3).
